resources.string: This test consist of three parts, all three parts must be attempted. The user must hold this position as long time as possible, max 30 seconds. If it is not possible to do the test, press the button with the right cause and continue to the next part. If the user grabs a hold of something, press the abort button so the time stops
Choose a color and compete against your friend. Be the first player who hits the tiles with your color 10 times, and who hits most within 1 minute.

All tiles light up in white, but hide another color. Step on a tile to reveal the hidden color. Thereafter, step on another tile trying to find the one with the same color to create a pair. When all pairs are found, you have won the game.

All tiles light up in white, but hide a sound. Step on a tile to reveal the hidden sound. Thereafter, step on another tile trying to find the one with the same sound to create a pair. When all pairs are found, you have won the game.

All tiles light up in white, but hide a number (number of lights turned on). Step on a tile to reveal the hidden number. Thereafter, step on another tile trying to find the one with the same number to create a pair. When all pairs are found, you have won the game.

All tiles light up in white, but hide a sound. Step on a tile to reveal the hidden sound. Thereafter, step on another tile trying to find the one with the same sound to create a pair. When all pairs are found, you have won the game.

The game tests the understanding of groups. Which items belong to the group (green), and which do not (red)? First, a set of items is recording to be included in the group (green) or excluded from the group (red). You have to press on a tile to hear the word/number/sentence/sound, and then press either green if it belongs to the group, or press red if it does not belong to the group. At the end, you will see, if you have made all correct, or how many you got right.
All tiles light up in blue. Keep light in all tiles by pressing on them before any tile count down to zero. Flashing red light means that you lost.

Different colors are shown on the tiles in fast flashes. Hurry up and step on the colors to keep them (freeze the color), and step on them again to make them switch color again. Make your own, nice patterns.
In this game you need to jump on the two red tiles at the same time, get the max score you can in the chosen round time
This test estimate the users coordination. Hit as many reds as possible
A simple piano, red is C, blue is D, green is E, indigo is F, orange is G, white is A and violet is B.

Choose a start position: place your right foot on a blue tile and left foot on another blue tile. Reach forward with your right foot to the tile that lights up in green, and then back to the right foot start positions (green light). Then step with the left foot on the tile that lights up in blue, and back to the left foot start position (blue light).

First enter a Pattern by stepping on the tiles in the desired sequence, and press Done on the tablet. When you start the game, you have to step on the tiles in the pattern that you have created, in each moment stepping on the tile that lights up in green.

Side-by-side will test the users endurance, coordination and balance. The user must complete as many side steps as possible in 30 seconds. Follow the same color with the same foot always. If the user needs help eg. with a cane or a holding a hand for support push the button “with help”.

The tiles light up in a specific sequence, starting with one tile. Press on the tiles in the same sequence as they were shown, in order to reach next round. A new tile will the added to the sequence for each round.
One tile lights up in a special color (another color than the rest of the tiles). Step on this special tile. For each 5 rounds, all colors will change, and you still have to step on the special one.

Hit the tile that lights up. See how fast you can go: the faster you hit the light, the faster it will move around on the tiles, so you can gain more points. If you do not hit, the light starts moving slower.

This test estimate the users speed. Measure 2,5 meters from the tiles and out in the room, mark the place with a cone or something visible. The user must walk around the cone as fast as possible. If the user needs help eg. with a cane or a holding a hand for support push the button “with help”
Place four tiles in a row and press the two central ones
Now press the two external tiles

This is the main game page, here you got score in real time of the current game in progress, you can also select on the fly the game\'s players and, in case of AutoTraining, you can control the training sequence warning the next player to be ready.
Stand in front of the tiles and select a tile with your right foot
Stand next to tiles and select a tile in the middle of the tiles with right foot
Stand next to tiles and select a tile in the middle of the tiles with right foot
Stand in front of the tiles and press play
Stand in front of the tiles and move your left foot on to a tile in front of you
Stand in front of the tiles and move your left foot on to a tile in front of you
Select a tile with you left foot next to the right and press start
Step on the tile in front of the selected tile and hold the position
Step on the tile in front of the selected tile
Move your right foot on to a tile next to the left one. Stay on the tiles
Move your right foot on the tile next to the left
Step behind the selected tile and hold the position
Move your left foot one tile left, step back to the original tile
Press play and wait for the sound signal to leave the tiles, walk around the cone and come back to the position
Move your right foot one tile right, step back to the original tile, press play

This is the detailed graphs page, here you can view all the players progress, you can choose the period and the data type to analyze for each player. You can also analyze the scores during time to understand the player progresses.
Tap player to add it to this group

This is where you can manage your player\'s groups. Add, modify and delete groups with the bottom buttons, after select the group you want to edit and tap on players names on top to add them to the group. You can also access the AutoTraining page where you can use your groups to start a training session.
Please press on %1$d tiles for player 1
Please press on %1$d tiles for player 2
Press play to start the game
For further informations go to www.mototiles.com
No internet connection\n\nOn first app startup you must be connected to internet
No internet connection\n\nPlease try again when you\'re connected
No Tiles connected\n\nTry to push the tiles or check if they are turned on
Your pattern is empty, click "Create pattern" to create a pattern
Press on tiles to define a pattern

This is the Player\'s page, here you can add, modify or delete players. A main graph show the player activity during the current week. In the bottom menu you can also access group managing and detailed graphs.
To play this game you need at least 4 tiles connected

This is the Settings page of the app, here you can setup your tiles set, syncronize all your games sessions with the main server, access the custom sound interface and modify your device info on your needs.
Are you sure you want to sync your data with the central server?
Are you sure you want to put tiles in standby?

This is the AutoTraining page, here you can create trainings for your groups of players choosing the games sequence so you don\'t need to start a new game every time. In the bottom menu you can also add new trainings and manage the groups.
